text: King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-Pileser, king of Assyria. During his visit he saw an altar16:10. Clearly a pagan altar, probably Assyrian. It is likely that Tiglath-pileser required subservient kings to prove their loyalty to him, and this action of Ahaz would have demonstrated this. in Damascus, and he sent Uriah the priest a drawing of the altar, along with instructions how to build it.
